articles.headline: Bringing Home Baby, Your Electric Car
articles.snippet: Buyers of electric cars will need to configure a charging station at home and find the cheapest time to charge it as well as locate charging stations near work or around town.
articles.abstract: Buyers of electric cars will need to configure a charging station at home and find the cheapest time to charge it as well as locate charging stations near work or around town.
articles.lead_paragraph: SO you’re thinking of buying or leasing an electric car, and you’re taking a hard look at the garage, filled with many years of accumulated junk and sporting a single 110-volt socket on the wall.

articles.headline: Gains in Afghan Training, but Struggles in War
articles.snippet: The training of troops has improved, officials say, but the soldiers’ performance is sowing doubts.
articles.abstract: The training of troops has improved, officials say, but the soldiers’ performance is sowing doubts.
articles.lead_paragraph: KABUL, Afghanistan  Long a lagging priority, the plan to produce many more highly trained Afghan troops is moving this fall at a rapid pace.

articles.headline: Fed Minutes Lend Weight to Stimulus
articles.snippet: A critical mass of officials at the Federal Reserve appears to favor taking new actions to reinvigorate the torpid recovery.
articles.abstract: A critical mass of officials at the Federal Reserve appears to favor taking new actions to reinvigorate the torpid recovery.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON  The Federal Reserve provided more evidence on Tuesday that a critical mass of officials at the central bank favored additional actions to reinvigorate the lagging recovery.

articles.headline: White House Lifts Ban on Deepwater Drilling
articles.snippet: The Obama administration lifted its deepwater drilling moratorium after imposing rules intended to prevent another disaster like the Gulf of Mexico rig explosion.
articles.abstract: The Obama administration lifted its deepwater drilling moratorium after imposing rules intended to prevent another disaster like the Gulf of Mexico rig explosion.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON  The Obama administration lifted the moratorium on deepwater oil and gas drilling on Tuesday, but it will be weeks or months before drilling resumes while industry and government regulators scramble to meet strict new rules intended to prevent another disaster like the Deepwater Horizon explosion and spill.
articles.byline: By Peter Baker and John M. Broder

articles.headline: Silicon Valley’s Solar Innovators Retool to Catch Up to China
articles.snippet: As California companies begin mass production of a new solar cell, the industry has been changed — by China.
articles.abstract: As California companies begin mass production of a new solar cell, the industry has been changed — by China.
articles.lead_paragraph: FREMONT, Calif.  A few years ago, Silicon Valley start-ups like Solyndra, Nanosolar and MiaSolé dreamed of transforming the economics of solar power by reinventing the technology used to make solar panels and deeply cutting the cost of production.

articles.headline: Detroit Refueled
articles.snippet: Buyers are reconsidering American cars because of improved fuel economy, good quality and high-tech features.
articles.abstract: Buyers are reconsidering American cars because of improved fuel economy, good quality and high-tech features.
articles.lead_paragraph: IT wasn’t long ago that American consumers were wondering whether Detroit’s troubled auto companies would survive, much less prosper again.

articles.headline: Judge Orders U.S. Military to Stop ‘Don’t Ask, Don’t Tell’
articles.snippet: A federal judge ordered the military to stop enforcing the “don’t ask, don’t tell” policy that prohibits openly gay and bisexual soldiers from serving.
articles.abstract: A federal judge ordered the military to stop enforcing the “don’t ask, don’t tell” policy that prohibits openly gay and bisexual soldiers from serving.
articles.lead_paragraph: A federal judge on Tuesday ordered the United States military to stop enforcing the “don’t ask, don’t tell” law that prohibits openly gay men and women from serving.

articles.headline: A Climate Proposal Beyond Cap and Trade
articles.snippet: An alternative in climate policy revolves around much more financing for clean energy research.
articles.abstract: An alternative in climate policy revolves around much more financing for clean energy research.

articles.headline: Rising Corn Prices Bring Fears of an Upswing in Food Costs
articles.snippet: Extreme weather this year has sent grain prices soaring, jolting commodities markets and creating fears of tight supplies that could eventually hit consumers’ wallets.
articles.abstract: Extreme weather this year has sent grain prices soaring, jolting commodities markets and creating fears of tight supplies that could eventually hit consumers’ wallets.
articles.lead_paragraph: First it was heat and drought in Russia. Then it was heat and too much rain in parts of the American Corn Belt. Extreme weather this year has sent grain prices soaring, jolting commodities markets and setting off fears of tight supplies that could eventually hit consumers’ wallets.

articles.headline: Across the U.S., Long Recovery Looks Like Recession
articles.snippet: The economy has fallen so far during the recent recession that it could take years to climb back.
articles.abstract: The economy has fallen so far during the recent recession that it could take years to climb back.
articles.lead_paragraph: This is not what a recovery is supposed to look like.
articles.byline: By Michael Powell and Motoko Rich

articles.headline: N.Y. Faces $200 Billion in Retiree Health Costs
articles.snippet: Almost nothing has been set aside, putting the public work force on a collision course with taxpayers.
articles.abstract: Almost nothing has been set aside, putting the public work force on a collision course with taxpayers.
articles.lead_paragraph: The cities, counties and authorities of New York have promised more than $200 billion worth of health benefits to their retirees while setting aside almost nothing, putting the public work force on a collision course with the taxpayers who are expected to foot the bill.

articles.headline: Intel Tries Anonymity, for a Change
articles.snippet: Intel has established one of the most well-known brands, but some new products make little mention of the company.
articles.abstract: Intel has established one of the most well-known brands, but some new products make little mention of the company.
articles.lead_paragraph: An average laptop contains about 1,800 components, but only one garners much brand awareness from typical consumers: the chip made by Intel.
